fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content:
At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

If you own multiple properties, please report on all your properties by watershed. If they are all within the same watershed, we would only need one pin. If you have property in multiple watersheds please complete this survey by watershed and place a pin in each watershed.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center pin on your property. If you own/lease multiple properties you'll only need to place one pin, but if you have other properties in other watersheds we would request a separate survey in each watershed and report acres by watershed.

fields.name: address
fields.prompt: _(Search by address)

fields.name: analysis_units_header
fields.content: 2. Watershed analysis unit

fields.name: analysis_unit
fields.prompt: _(Of the eight watersheds on the map, which unit primarily represents your farm or ranch?  All reporting for VSP will be at the watershed scale level. Complete multiple surveys for areas that are distinctly different.)

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content: 3. Wetland Areas

fields.name: wetlands_information
fields.content:
Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: _(Are there any wetlands? Please note locations are approximate.)

fields.name: salmon_steelhead_habitat_header
fields.content: 4. Salmon & Steelhead Habitat

fields.name: salmon_steelhead_habitat_information
fields.content:
Description

Salmon & Steelhead Habitat are managed to maintain populations of salmon and steelhead.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_salmon_steelhead_habitat
fields.prompt: _(Are there any fish bearing streams? Please note locations are approximate.)

fields.name: fish_wildlife_habitat_header
fields.content: 5. Fish & Wildlife Habitat (PHS)

fields.name: fish_wildlife_habitat_information
fields.content:
Description

Fish & wildlife habitats are managed to maintain populations of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_fish_wildlife_habitat
fields.prompt: _(Are there any fish & wildlife conservation areas? Please note locations are approximate.)

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content: 6. Critical Aquifer Recharge Areas

fields.name: critical_aquifer_information
fields.content:
Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: _(Are there any critical aquifer recharge areas? Please note locations are approximate.)

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content: 7. Severe Geologic Hazard Areas

fields.name: geologic_hazard_information
fields.content:
Description

Severe geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: _(Are there any severe geologic hazard areas? Please note locations are approximate.)

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content: 8. Frequently Flooded Areas

fields.name: frequently_flooded_information
fields.content:
Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: _(Are there any frequently flooded areas? Please note locations are approximate.)

fields.name: additional_info_header
fields.content: 15. Almost completed!

fields.name: additional_info
fields.content:
Thank you for taking the time to voluntarily report your stewardship practices.

This page will determine how your information is shared. We will report all practices at the watershed scale, but if you are interested in having your project showcased you can give us permission below. Either way, we will be using your stewardship practice to capture how agriculture is protecting and/or restoring critical areas and maintaining the viability of agriculture.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: _(Show your stewardship practices! Upload photos before, during, or after you implemented your stewardship practices:)
fields.label: _(Upload photos)

fields.name: practices_description
fields.prompt: _(Add a description of your stewardship practices!)

fields.name: private-landowner_name
fields.placeholder: _(Your name will only be shared if you are logged in)
fields.prompt: _(What is your name?)

fields.name: private-use_photos
fields.prompt: _(Can Garfield County VSP highlight your photos on our website?)

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: _(Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public? Checking "yes" below will place a pin on the map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be visible to the public.)

fields.name: private-landowner_email
fields.placeholder: _(Your email address will never be shared)
fields.prompt: _(What is your email address?)

fields.name: private-landowner_phone
fields.prompt: _(What is your phone number?)
fields.placeholder: _(Your phone number will never be shared)

content: Your Garfield County VSP Coordinators are interested in helping meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator or for more information visit: www.garfieldcountyvsp.com.

Welcome Garfield County Voluntary Stewards!

Get Started

Garfield County Voluntary Stewardship Program (VSP) provides an innovative approach for reporting the protection of critical areas on agriculture lands that enhance our environment through voluntary measures, while promoting agriculture viability. VSP voluntarily collects previous and on-going stewardship data from all interested landowners, which helps document VSP participation and the importance of agriculture viability.
Help promote Garfield County agriculture by sharing stewardship strategies!
VSP success relies on voluntary participation by landowners!
Garfield County VSP appreciates your time sharing stewardship practices!
